I’ve personally been using one of Addtam’s outlet extenders in my office for well over a year now.

Now, Microsoft wants to be part of the AI browser conversation. I sat down with Microsoft AI CEO Mustafa Suleyman today to talk about […]

items.title: In a letter to Rep. Jim Jordan, YouTube says it will reinstate creators it banned for COVID and election misinfo, and blames Biden officials for the bans (Ashleigh Fields/The Hill)
items.summary:
Ashleigh Fields / The Hill:
In a letter to Rep. Jim Jordan, YouTube says it will reinstate creators it banned for COVID and election misinfo, and blames Biden officials for the bans  —  YouTube's parent company, Alphabet, on Tuesday said it would reinstate creators previously banned for spreading misinformation about COVID-19 and false election content.

items.title: Baseus’ retractable 100W USB-C cable can charge two devices at once, grab it for $20.50 (Reg. $30)
items.summary:
Baseus Retractable 100W 2-in-1 USB-C Cable

Buy for $20.50 (Reg. $30)

What we love

If you’re anything like me, you gravitate towards retractable cables whenever possible. While you can tidy up cords with ties, cover, and the like, retractability is great when you have to use a cable here and there and don’t want your space to look messy. This one steps up what we’re used to seeing, turning a single USB-C cable into two with support for up to 100W of total output.

Buy for $25 (Reg. $70)

What we love

While the newer, more capable 25W Qi2.2 chargers are starting to show up, snagging a solid 3-in-1 15W Qi2 station like this for just $25 is tough to beat. You’re getting full 15W MagSafe charging for iPhone and other Qi2 compatible phones, a built-in Apple Watch puck, and a dedicated AirPods pad – all in one tidy setup. The highlight here is the LED base with five ambient color options, giving your desk or nightstand a clean, modern look while keeping everything powered.

items.title: Own your apps with Microsoft Office Pro for Windows at $50 (Reg. $240).
items.summary:
You can now grab Microsoft Office Pro 2021 for Windows for just $49.99 (Reg. $239.99). There are so many new tools for everything. Going to the app store now is like going to the grocery store, seeing thousands of brands selling the same thing. How many document apps do we need? Or project management apps and spreadsheets? Especially when so many of the new tools are filled with unnecessary features and back-end bugs. Why go through the trouble when the classic tools are still the most effective? That’s why Microsoft Office Pro 2021 for Windows is still one of the most popular business suites in the world.

items.summary: BEIRUT, Sept. 23 (Xinhua) -- When Jihad al-Abdallah returned to his hometown of Khiam, near the Israeli border in southern Lebanon, he felt as though he had stepped into another world. Read full story

items.title: South Sudan launches health campaign to protect over 3 mln people from diseases
items.summary: JUBA, Sept. 23 (Xinhua) -- South Sudan, in partnership with two United Nations (UN) agencies, on Tuesday launched an integrated health campaign to protect over 2.1 million children and 1.2 million adults from polio and schistosomiasis, two debilitating diseases. Read full story

items.summary: JOHANNESBURG, Sept. 23 (Xinhua) -- The South Africa-China Trade and Investment Promotion Conference and the ninth China-South Africa Trade Fair opened in Johannesburg on Tuesday, drawing thousands of participants seeking to deepen trade and investment ties. Read full story

items.title: Feature: Chinese agrochemical products draw spotlight at Kenya expo
items.summary: NAIROBI, Sept. 23 (Xinhua) -- At a bustling booth at the seventh CAC Africa Summit in Nairobi, Kenya's capital, Brighton Kisero carefully examined a small bottle of bio-pesticide. For the agrochemical wholesaler, the product stood out not only for its environmentally friendly promise but also for its suitability to Africa's unique soils and climates. Read full story

items.title: WHO urges African countries to expand access to palliative care
items.summary: GABORONE, Sept. 23 (Xinhua) -- The World Health Organization (WHO) on Tuesday called on African countries to prioritize the integration of palliative care into national health systems, making it universally available, accessible, and affordable for all people on the continent. Read full story

Microsoft says it is experimenting with microfluidics, which involves sending fluid through channels in AI and server chips to improve cooling efficiency  —  Small amounts of fluid passed through channels etched on chips can save energy and boost AI systems.

This model with this particular battery usually goes for $250 at full price, but you’re getting a $75 markdown through the rest of the day that lands it $5 under the usual $180 rate we’ve seen pop up over 2025 in these one-day sales. This is the best price we’ve spotted in 2025, with it only beaten out by the $170 low we last saw during Black Friday last year.
